title: Ticket #1552: LOCAL_CONFIG_DIR
description:
Tony reports that editing files with vi in LOCAL_CONFIG_DIR is problematic, because condor tries to read the .filename.swp file. emacs backup files could pose a similar problem.

Proposal

Add a configurable filename pattern that can be used to blacklist (or maybe also whitelist) files in LOCAL_CONFIG_DIR. Example:

LOCAL_CONFIG_DIR_EXCLUDE_REGEXP = (\..*)|(.*~)|(#.*)

This would be a good STUDENTTASK.
remarks:
2010-Aug-17 14:54:36 by danb:
Will, thanks for the patch! Some comments:

  1. In the call to EXCEPT(), do not pass the regexp parse error directly. EXCEPT() is like printf(). The first argument is a format string. If the error message happens to have percent signs in it, then they will be interpreted argument substitution commands. Anyway, you should provide more context in the error message such as this: 
    EXCEPT("LOCAL_CONFIG_DIR_EXCLUDE_REGEXP is not a valid regular expression: %s",_errstr ? _errstr : "")

  2. The return value of param() is a string that needs to be freed by the caller.

  3. When we skip a file due to this regexp, please log something to that effect at debug level D_FULLDEBUG|D_CONFIG.

  4. The default value of this configuration setting should be specified in param_info.in. I think the default should exclude files beginning with "." as well as vi and emacs tmp files, so maybe this: ^((\..*)|(.*~)|(#.*))$

2010-Aug-18 09:42:36 by danb:
By default, we should also exclude filenames ending in .rpmsave and .rpmnew.

2010-Nov-12 10:58:41 by tmckay:
Began with the original patch, incorporated feedback items from danb above. Modified a bit for readability, changed allocation of Regexp to static since it's small. Tested using the following rough sequence with rebuilt condor_master:

Add the following lines to condor_config.local on a personal Condor 

##LOCAL_CONFIG_DIR_EXCLUDE_REGEXP =
LOCAL_CONFIG_DIR = /home/mckay/condor/local.tmckaylt
MASTER_DEBUG=D_CONFIG

Created spurious files in local config dir: 

$ cd /home/mckay/condor/local.tmckaylt
$ touch "#blah" blah~ blah.rpmnew blah.rpmsave .blah

Empty MasterLog, run condor_master, check logs. Last two lines from grep represent config files read. 

$ rm /home/mckay/condor/local.tmckaylt/log/MasterLog
$ condor_master
$ grep local\.tmckaylt /home/mckay/condor/local.tmckaylt/log/MasterLog
11/12/10 11:38:36 Ignoring config file based on LOCAL_CONFIG_DIR_EXCLUDE_REGEXP, '/home/mckay/condor/local.tmckaylt/#blah'
11/12/10 11:38:36 Ignoring config file based on LOCAL_CONFIG_DIR_EXCLUDE_REGEXP, '/home/mckay/condor/local.tmckaylt/blah.rpmsave'
11/12/10 11:38:36 Ignoring config file based on LOCAL_CONFIG_DIR_EXCLUDE_REGEXP, '/home/mckay/condor/local.tmckaylt/.blah'
11/12/10 11:38:36 Ignoring config file based on LOCAL_CONFIG_DIR_EXCLUDE_REGEXP, '/home/mckay/condor/local.tmckaylt/blah~'
11/12/10 11:38:36 Ignoring config file based on LOCAL_CONFIG_DIR_EXCLUDE_REGEXP, '/home/mckay/condor/local.tmckaylt/blah.rpmnew'
11/12/10 11:38:36    /home/mckay/condor/local.tmckaylt/condor_config.local
11/12/10 11:38:36    /home/mckay/condor/local.tmckaylt/condor_config.local

Override LOCAL_CONFIG_DIR_EXCLUDE_REGEXP in condor_config.local: 

LOCAL_CONFIG_DIR_EXCLUDE_REGEXP =
LOCAL_CONFIG_DIR = /home/mckay/condor/local.tmckaylt
MASTER_DEBUG=D_CONFIG

Repeat test, all files parsed: 

$ rm /home/mckay/condor/local.tmckaylt/log/MasterLog
$ condor_master
$ grep local\.tmckaylt /home/mckay/condor/local.tmckaylt/log/MasterLog
11/12/10 11:50:31    /home/mckay/condor/local.tmckaylt/condor_config.local
11/12/10 11:50:31    /home/mckay/condor/local.tmckaylt/#blah
11/12/10 11:50:31    /home/mckay/condor/local.tmckaylt/.blah
11/12/10 11:50:31    /home/mckay/condor/local.tmckaylt/blah.rpmnew
11/12/10 11:50:31    /home/mckay/condor/local.tmckaylt/blah.rpmsave
11/12/10 11:50:31    /home/mckay/condor/local.tmckaylt/blah~
11/12/10 11:50:31    /home/mckay/condor/local.tmckaylt/condor_config.local

Change regular expression to something illegal: 

LOCAL_CONFIG_DIR_EXCLUDE_REGEXP = ((.*\.rmpsave|(.*\.rpmnew))
LOCAL_CONFIG_DIR = /home/mckay/condor/local.tmckaylt
MASTER_DEBUG=D_CONFIG

Run again: 

$ condor_master
ERROR "LOCAL_CONFIG_DIR_EXCLUDE_REGEXP config parameter is not a valid regular expression.  Value: ((.*\.rmpsave|(.*\.rpmnew)),  Error: missing )" at line 937 in file condor_config.cpp

Add an entry to condor_config.generic for this, and have it uncommented since there is no default in the code - even though there is a default in the param table.

2010-Nov-13 07:56:24 by matt:

2010-Nov-19 09:21:10 by danb:
The patch looks good to me. Matt, why would you prefer to have the config value uncommented in condor_config.generic? I usually prefer to have things commented out in the example config file so that stale config files are less likely to preserve stale defaults (also we save a little memory).

2010-Nov-19 09:50:48 by matt:
Only because there is no default in the code. I had an eye more toward 7.4 where the param table is turned off. On 7.5 I guess there essentially is a default in the code, present in the param table.

Whatever it takes to have a sane blacklist by default.
